intro: Pleurogyne minor, commonly known as the small pleurogyne, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in moist, swampy environments. Pleurogyne minor is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and lakes.
